author: B Kolappan
text:
How far is ‘jallikattu’ a part of Tamil culture and ancient tradition? A translation of Kalitogai , a major work in Sangam literature by A.K. Ramanujan, gives a vivid description of the ancient sport known as ‘Eru Thazuval’: “That the bull is wilder than an elephant gone wild; do not loosen your hand’s grip on him, and the shoulders of our girl will bring you victory flags.”

Noted historian A.L. Basham in his book, ‘The Wonder that is India’ says the bullfight was seen as a test of manhood. However, he hastens to add that “though Tamil literature gives no evidence of this, the bullfight had certainly some ritual significance.”

Basham also appears to note that far from being associated with glory, it was a gory sport.
title: ‘Jallikattu’ in Tamil culture
